Mipuun BAUKHo l&caH- ‘«8HA» ^rSixllXntn,,. , ^V l|/ KH ~'° 8 ) ^-V/v / XC&hkAlh{ jjShcJi'&oS^t- o/Khanm h oBudu hDnjnxn/ Compiled in the Office of the Surveyor General of India, Calcutta, 1870. With additions to November 1877. Sir nit of Lo r muz NOTE.—The following authorities have been consulted in the construction of this Map:— 1. Keith Johnstone’s Map of Persia. 2. Turkistan by Colonel J. T. Walker, R. E., Supdt. Great Trigonometrical Survey of India, 1875. 3. A Map of Turkistan to illustrate the travels of Arminius Vamberyin 1863. 4. Weiland’s Map of Persia, Afghanistan and Baluchistan, 1854. 5. Map of Afghanistan compiled in the Surveyor General’s Office, Calcutta, 1841. 6. Map of the Sea of Aral and Khanate of Khiva by Khanikoff. 7. Map of Persia by Major O. St. John, R. E. 8. Route from Shiraz to Bam and Sketch Map of Seistan Boundary by Major Lovett, R. E. 9. The Northern Frontier of Khorassan with parts of Irak and Mazandaran by Captain the Honourable G. Napier, 1876. 10. Sketch Map to illustrate explorations made in connection with the operations of the Great Trigonometrical Survey in 1876 by Mullah. 11. Baluchistan, or the territories of His Highness the Khan of Kelat, compiled in the Surveyor General’s Office, Calcutta, 1877. Persia and Turkey is still approximately given only. NOTE.-Ti WYOERABAD 1077

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Sketch of the Countries between Hindustan and the Caspian Sea'

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: printed on paper, with colouring.Dimensions: 580 x 790mm, on sheet 680 x 830mm.

mods.abstract: A large-scale map showing a region encompassing modern-day Iran, Afghanistan, Pakistan and Turkmenistan, as well as parts of Uzbekistan, India, Iraq, Azerbaijan, Saudi Arabia, Bahrain, Qatar, and the United Arab Emirates.Compiled in the Office of the Surveyor General of India, Calcutta, 1870. With additions to November 1877.Scale: 64 miles = 1 inch.The map bears a note of the eleven sources consulted in its construction, and shows telegraph lines and stations.The map bears the following printing statement: 'Photozincographed under the Superintendence of Captn J Waterhouse. Price Colored One Rupee Eight Annas.'
